posts.title: Grabbing Facebook Token without user intervention
posts.description: Starting today, Facebook is starting to change their Graph API to match the REST way, and so they are requiring an access_token for every request.  Now I've ran into a problem with just getting the feed from a Page, which didn't require a token before to just "read" them.  All I want to do is just read the feed, but Facebook mostly has code and documentation for getting a token only if the user gets permission initially, but it breaks the client's flow.  I found the above code actually just grabs a token associated with the AppId I had to create to get access to a feed -- once that's done, I just passed it on to my ongoing calls.
posts.formatted_content:
ruby

response = open(URI.encode('graph.facebook.com/oauth/…=' + fb['app_id'] + '&client_secret=' + fb['app_secret'])) JSON.parse(response.read)['access_token']

// php $response = file_get_contents('graph.facebook.com/oauth/…);
parse_str($response, $params); $access_token = $params['access_token'];
posts.formatted_description: Starting today, Facebook is starting to change their Graph API to match the REST way, and so they are requiring an access_token for every request. Now I've ran into a problem with just getting the feed from a Page, which didn't require a token before to just "read" them. All I want to do is just read the feed, but Facebook mostly has code and documentation for getting a token only if the user gets permission initially, but it breaks the client's flow. I found the above code actually just grabs a token associated with the AppId I had to create to get access to a feed -- once that's done, I just passed it on to my ongoing calls.

posts.title: Execute Node.js from TextMate
posts.description:
I've been looking around for bundles to test my Node.js applications in TextMate, but none of them fitted my needs (most didn't accept apps with sockets, etc) so I made a command for the JavaScript bundle myself.

Simply go to __Bundles -> Bundle Editor -> Bundle Commands__.
Go to the __JavaScript__ Bundle and click the + below the list and choose for __New Command__ and name it something like _Run JavaScript in Node_.

Now go for the following settings:
![Node.js for TextMate](http://we.gs/78e16b21.png)

__Please note:__ You must add your Node.js path to your TextMate PATH settings. Do this by going to __TextMate -> Preferences -> Advanced__ and add your Node.js location to the PATH variable.

Hope this saves you some time searching.

posts.title: Count total number of lines in a codebase
posts.content:
ext='php'
type='l'

if [ $# == 2 ]
then
	ext=$2
fi

if [ $# == 3 ]
then
	type=$3
fi

bar="=================================================="
barlength=${#bar}

lines=0
current=0
total=`find -iname "*.${ext}" | wc -l`
# echo $files
find $1 -iname "*.${ext}" > files


STDOUT=$(find $1 -iname "*.${ext}")
while read FILE
do
	lines=$((lines + `wc -$type < "$FILE"`))
	# echo $((100*(++current)/total))
	p=$(((++current) * 100 / total))
	n=$(((current) * barlength / total ))
	printf "\r[%-${barlength}s] %i" "${bar:0:n}" $p
done <<< "$STDOUT"

printf "\r\n"
printf "\rNumber of lines: $lines\r\n"
posts.description:
## DESCRIPTION
This little script counts the number of lines in a specific directory. Use it the following way:

## USAGE
`sh lines.sh`
> Default. This will search for php-files in the directory this script is in.

`sh lines.sh [DIR]`
> [DIR = the specific directory, default = .]

`sh lines.sh [DIR] [EXT]`
> [EXT = the specific file extension (without a dot), default = php]

`sh lines.sh [DIR] [EXT] [TYPE]`
> [TYPE = what should we be looking for (list below), default = l]

## TYPEs

- *c*    counts the total number of bytes.
- *m*   counts the total number of characters.
- *l*    counts the total number of lines.
- *L*    counts the total sum of all longest lines.
- *w*    counts the total number of words.

Note that this code is for the Thesis Framework for WordPress.
